thread.title: Burger Chain Leaves California for Greener Pastures
thread.title_full: Burger Chain Leaves California for Greener Pastures

author: K. Campbell
title: Burger Chain Leaves California for Greener Pastures
text:
Tattoo Removal Business EXPLODING Due to Deportation Fears 
Although CKE noted that the move was also motivated by the need for less office space and desire to consolidate operations, tax savings were undoubtedly a big factor in the decision, as well as the stifling regulatory environment on the left coast, “where businesses are treated like villains and rich people as cash dispensers for big government programs,” IBD explained. 
In fact, the highest income tax rate in California is 13 percent. Compare that to Tennessee, where the tax rate is zero, and the decision to relocate was likely a no-brainer and will save the company millions of dollars on taxes. 
And CKE hasn’t been the first to leave California in search of more business-friendly environments, as nearly 9,000 other companies have expanded elsewhere or pulled up stakes altogether since 2008, according to a 2016 Breitbart News analysis. Advertisement - story continues below 
More competitive states, like Tennessee, have been aggressively recruiting these California-defectors with incentives such as free or heavily subsidized real estate, expedited project approvals and low or no state income taxes. 
To make matters worse, it hasn’t appeared that California lawmakers have learned their lesson about stifling business growth, as Gov. Jerry Brown has signed hundreds of new regulations every year — regulations that require more paperwork and restrictions that most business owners don’t have the time — nor the desire — to take on, particularly when other states have welcomed them with open arms. 
But, isn’t that the liberal way — forcing everyone to follow ridiculous policies and regulations, despite hard evidence that they’re unsuccessful?
